channel.title: Brian and Benn's MP3 Movie Talk Show: a hilarious irreverent look at movies and those who make them
channel.description: If Hollywood knew what Brian Felts and Benn Farrell were saying about it, the pair would be banned from the cinemas. Since May 2005, Felts and Farrell have left no subject taboo when it comes to movies, entertainment news, Tinseltown celebrities and filmmakers, taking film discussion and criticism to a new level of hilarity and irreverence. In this weekly podcast, the duo offers a variety of features including prize contests, listener requests and bad movie challenges with a dynamic cast of side-splitting commentators. Movies have it coming, and Felts and Farrell are here to dish it out every week at www.bbmcreviews.com. This is the one podcast you won't regret subscribing! What other movie podcast has received a letter from the White House? Come hear what you're missing! "I loved the show---you guys crack me up! ... I will have to start keeping you on my calendar to listen to your show." - Ron (Denver, Colo.)

item.title: Be Four and After
item.description: Brian and Benn discuss "Star Trek," "X-Men Origins: Wolverine" and "The Soloist" in the New in Cinemas segment. The duo spend the rest of the show re-visiting hilarious moments from their fourth year of podcasting, including past guests like Joan Gandy, Jon Baird, Kimmy Deranged and others. Also features Kiersten the News Lady, Outtake of the Week, festival and submission updates and featured music from Low-fidelity Jet-set Orchestra on Hammondbeat Records in our special FIFTH SEASON KICKOFF!
item.author: dockratent@hotmail.com (Benn Farrell)

item.description: Brian and Benn discuss "Burn After Reading," "Righteous Kill" and "Hamlet 2" in their New in Cinemas segment. Benn also has a review for "Baby Mama" in the duo's New on DVD jaunt. Throughout the entire show Brian and Benn call people to gather opinions on who should play them in the bio-pic Hollywood will eventually make on BBMC; also features Kiersten the News Lady, Outtake of the Week; festival and submission updates and featured music from Phat Fred on Hammondbeat Records.

item.title: Baby, Come Back! Pt. 2
item.description: Brian and Benn welcomes special guest casting director Carmen Aiello of Hollywood and discuss a filmmaker submission movie The Bilbee Boys and speak with its writer-director Matthew Nelson. Special guest commentary Joan Gandy returns for another Gandy Rant. The boys interview actor-filmmaker David Dietz (www.dietzthethird.com), and they attempt to review as many movies possible in two minutes in their 120-Second Review Run. Actress-model Bianca Barnett (www.biancabarnett.com) joins the show for an interview by phone, and a special Hollywood celebrity pays a special visit to talk about his roll in Tropic Thunder. Listeners have a chance to win free crap with the What-The-Fuck-Is-Benn-Talking-About Contest with guest Tony Lutheran. Also includes outtakes and festival updates and submissions in this second installment of Brian and Benn's special two-part comeback episode.

item.title: Baby, Come Back! Pt. 1
item.description: Brian and Benn discuss The Dark Knight, The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor, Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull and Pineapple Express in their New in Cinemas segment. The duo also discus Nim's Island in their New on DVD section and Southland Tales in their Buried on DVD jaunt. Special guest Kim Collins of the Go Go Gore Girls joins the cast by phone to talk about The Strangers. Guest commentator Spencer returns for another outting of "Spencer Says..." and you have a chance to win free crap with the BBMC Name the Celebrity Contest; also features Kiersten the News Lady and festival submission updates in this special extended episode.
